claim.text: 150 millimeters of snow water equivalent — roughly a 40-centimeter snowfall
claim.claim: 150 millimeters of snow water equivalent equals roughly 40 centimeters of snowfall

results.summary: The conversion implies an unusually dense snow ratio of approximately 2.7:1, far below the standard 10:1 average ratio.
results.detail: Standard meteorological practice uses a 10:1 snow-to-water ratio as the average, meaning 150mm SWE would typically produce approximately 150cm of snowfall, not 40cm. A 40cm snowfall from 150mm SWE implies a ratio of ~2.7:1, which represents extremely dense, wet snow that is atypical. While snow density varies widely (5:1 for very wet snow to 20:1+ for powder), the 2.7:1 ratio stated here is at the extreme end. The claim may be technically possible in very specific wet snow conditions but misrepresents typical SWE-to-snowfall conversions.
sources: Standard meteorological snow-water equivalent ratios (10:1 average, range 5:1 to 20:1)
National Weather Service snow measurement guidelines
